Avian botulism is a paralytic, often fatal, disease of birds that results when they ingest toxin produced by the bacterium, Clostridium botulinum. Learn more about how avian botulism affects birds in Hawaii: https://www.usgs.gov/centers/nwhc/science/avian-botulism â€¦

Spring cleaning is here for many of us & the Ministry of Health is reminding residents to take precautions against hantavirus. The virus can be found in deer mice droppings and urine. People can get the virus by breathing in contaminated airborne particles when cleaning #YQR
